concept.title: SNMP GET OIDs
concept.shortdesc: There are several object identifiers (OID) available from the system via SNMP from the network management card (NMC). The OIDs needs to be requested with a GET from a MIB browser with correctly configured access to the NMC. The OIDs can show both analog and digital values, see respective section.

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Describes available SNMP GET-based OIDs from the UPS system for monitoring model identity, firmware, battery status, power parameters, environmental sensors and modular subsystem diagnostics.

section.title: Analog Values from OIDs
section.p: The following table shows the analog values that are available as GET requests.
section.note: Base OID Address for APC / Reality: .1.3.6.1.4.1.318.
If an OID is not supported it will return “No data available in this sub-tree” or “There is no such object in this MIB”.

entry.ph: The detailed model information of the system used by the NMC.
The firmware revision of the system controller (MCU).
The date when the system was manufactured. In the format mm/dd/yy or yyyy.
A unique identifying number for the system controller (MCU) set at the factory, the number is not related to any number on the system rating plate.
Indicates the status of the battery.
The date when the battery were last replaced. In the format mm/dd/yy or mm/dd/yyyy.
Indicates the status of the battery breaker(s) in the system.

sl.sli: 2 = At least one of the battery breakers are closed

entry.ph: The measured battery temperature by the system’s battery temperature sensor. The temperature unit depends on the NMC setting. Value is with one decimal (tenths), temperatures below zero reads as 0. [°C / °F]
The measured battery current with one decimal (tenths). [A]
The measured battery bus voltage with one decimal (tenths). [V]
The measured frequency of the system input. [Hz]
The total active input power (sum of all three phases) of the system. [kW]
The measured voltage of the system input. [V]
The measured frequency with one decimal (tenths). [Hz]
The measured bypass voltage with one decimal (tenths). [V]
The measured voltage with one decimal (tenths). [V]
The measured voltage of the system output. [V]
The measured frequency of the system output. [Hz]
The measured current of the system output. [A]
The total active output power (sum of all three phases) of the system. [W]
The total apparent output power (sum of all three phases) of the system. [W]
The measured inverter load of the system output.
The total percent output power (sum of all three phases) of the system. [%]
The total active inverter output power of the system. [W]
The measured percent load of the system output.
The measured inverter current of the system output.
The measured reactive power of the system output.
The measured inverter voltage of the system voltage.
The measured output voltage with one decimal (tenths). [V]
The measured output frequency with one decimal (tenths). [Hz]
The measured output current with one decimal (tenths). [A]
The configured maximum ampere hours of the battery bank. The value shows the maximum battery capacity configured for the system regardless of the breaker positions. [Ah]
The date of the latest performed battery diagnostic test. In the format YYYY-MM-DD.
The result of the latest performed battery discharge test.
The result of the latest successful battery discharge test.
The status of the communication from the SNMP agent to the system.
An ASCII string containing the 64 flags representing the active specific alarms for Reality Modular. For more information about the flags see the chapter .
The hardware revision of the NMC.
The set nominal DC output voltage of the system with one decimal (tenths). [V]
The set output current rating of the system with one decimal (tenths). [A]
The measured DC output voltage of the system with one decimal (tenths). [V]
The measured output current of the system with one decimal (tenths). [A]
The assigned ID of the port on the NMC where the temperature (or temperature and humidity) sensor is attached.
The assigned ID of the temperature (or temperature and humidity) sensor connected to the NMC.
The entered name of the temperature (or temperature and humidity) sensor connected to the NMC. Can be changed from the NMC interface.
The entered location of the temperature (or temperature and humidity) sensor connected to the NMC. Can be changed from the NMC interface.
The measured temperature by the temperature (or temperature and humidity) sensor in Fahrenheit. [°F]
The measured temperature by the temperature (or temperature and humidity) sensor in Celsius. [°C]
The measured relative humidity by the temperature and humidity sensor in percent. [%]
Indicates the reason for why an alarm is active for the sensor. Should be read as a bit map, where each bit represents if the alarm condition is active = 1 or inactive = 0.
The alarm status of the temperature (or temperature and humidity) sensor connected to the NMC.
The status of the communication between the NMC and the connected temperature or temperature and humidity sensor.
Index for the first phase (L1) for the rectifier input.
Index for the first phase (L2) for the rectifier input.
Index for the first phase (L3) for the rectifier input.
The current state or operation mode of the system.
